page.title: 04Easby Lane, West Gt.Ayton
page.content: Easby Lane runs south from the Stone Bridge towards the village of Easby. The houses near the bridge are the oldest in the village (18th. century or earlier). This is part of the village's Conservation Zone, so the external character and appearance is being retained as the interiors are being modernized with grant help. The Buck Inn, opposite Low Green has recently been modernized. There is a Fish-and Chip Takeaway establishment here as well as a garage and a craft shop. An obelisk in a garden marks the former location of Captain James Cook's cottage. Beyond comes the 1950s' Marwood estate built in the post-war boom years and the 1970s' Byemoor estate. Between the older and newer housing areas is Cumbor's Nurseries growing shrubs plants and vegetables for sale.
